item.title: How To Make a Net DIY
item.dc:creator: Neil Mahaseth
item.description:
Hi friends in this video I will show you how I created a net using polyethylene or nylon rope for my gardening needs. This will be a detailed step-by-step DIY...

The post How To Make a Net DIY appeared first on Plants My Love.
item.content:encoded:
Hi friends in this video I will show you how I created a net using polyethylene or nylon rope for my gardening needs. This will be a detailed step-by-step DIY project so make sure to watch through the complete video. The benefit of making your own net is you can customize the dimension and the mesh size depending on your needs.

▼Scan @ Video Index▼

  • 00:00 Intro
  • 0:15 Uses for Plastic Net
  • 0:39 Things Required
  • 1:40 Tying the Horizontal Thread
  • 1:54 Calculating Length of Thread
  • 3:16 Attaching Vertical Strings
  • 4:20 Cutting Vertical Strings
  • 4:41 Tying Vertical Strings
  • 5:19 Spacing Vertical Strings
  • 6:28 Tightening Vertical Strings
  • 7:38 Creating the Diamond Pattern
  • 9:50 Final Look of the Net
  • 10:32 Tying Botton of the Net

I hope friends, you liked this video guide on How To Make a Net DIY. If yes, don’t forget to share this video with your friends and family whom you think could benefit from it. If you liked this, you might also like our other gardening-related content. Make sure to subscribe to our YouTube channel or join our mailing list to be alerted as soon as a new video is released. Thanks for watching friends see you later bye.

The post How To Make a Net DIY appeared first on Plants My Love.

The post How to Make Homemade Compost appeared first on Plants My Love.
item.content:encoded:
Hi friends in this video I will share my experience of generating homemade compost for the past three years. I will share with you the complete details of my system so that you can also replicate it at your home.

  • 00:00 Intro

  • 7:19 Compost Pile Aeration

  • 14:19 Extract Finished Compost

item.title: DIY Durable UV Resistant Plastic Pot
item.dc:creator: Neil Mahaseth
item.description:
In this DIY project, I will show you how I converted a normal plastic container into a UV Resistant Plastic Pot. The materials used for this project are cheap and...

The post DIY Durable UV Resistant Plastic Pot appeared first on Plants My Love.
item.content:encoded:
In this DIY project, I will show you how I converted a normal plastic container into a UV Resistant Plastic Pot. The materials used for this project are cheap and easily available.

▼ Materials @ Used ▼

  • Plastic Container
  • Aluminum Foil
  • Cello Tape
  • Metal Rod

I hope friends, you liked this video guide on DIY Durable UV Resistant Plastic Pot. If yes, don’t forget to share this video with your friends and family whom you think could benefit from it. Thanks for watching friends see you later bye.

item.title: How to Prevent Water Seepage in your Terrace Garden
item.dc:creator: Neil Mahaseth
item.description:
In this DIY project, I will show you how I prevent water damage/ seepage in my terrace garden. The materials used for this project are cheap and easily available. So...

The post How to Prevent Water Seepage in your Terrace Garden appeared first on Plants My Love.
item.content:encoded:
In this DIY project, I will show you how I prevent water damage/ seepage in my terrace garden. The materials used for this project are cheap and easily available. So you can easily implement it in your terrace garden.

I hope friends, you liked this video guide on how to prevent water seepage in the terrace garden. If yes, don’t forget to share this video with your friends and family whom you think could benefit from it. If you liked this, you might also like our other gardening-related content. Make sure to subscribe to our YouTube channel or join our mailing list to be alerted as soon as a new video is released. Thanks for watching friends see you later bye.

▼ Materials @ Used ▼

  • Brick
  • Plywood
  • Cello Tape
  • Brown Tape
  • Hand Saw

The post How to Prevent Water Seepage in your Terrace Garden appeared first on Plants My Love.
